render.tex: \title{Set builder \& roster notations} Understanding \& working with sets expressed in either of the two forms

reason.tex: %text There are two ways of expressing sets Either one can write out all the elements that are in the set. This is the \underline\text{roster form} -- from the English word 'roster' For example, below is the set of positive even integers less than 10 \[ \quad E = \left\lbrace 2,4,6,8 \right\rbrace\] Alternatively, one can write the \underline\text{recipe} for how the set is built. This is called the \underline\text{set-builder} form. For example, the above set can also be written as \[ \quad E = \left\lbrace x : x = 2k,\, 1\leq k < 5, k\in\mathbb{Z} \right\rbrace\] It is the \underline\text{same set, written differently}%
